revised_title: Reevaluating the Phylogenetic Position of Latimeria: A Reassessment of Coelacanth-Chondrichthyan Relationships
tldr: This article examines the relationship between coelacanths and chondrichthyans, questioning the hypothesis that they are sister groups. The author argues that Latimeria, a coelacanth, is more closely related to bony fishes rather than chondrichthyans based on the analysis of various character complexes and physiological similarities. The widespread occurrence of urea retention in different species challenges the use of this trait as evidence for a coelacanth-chondrichthyan link.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Evolution
